info.title: Environment, Health and Safety Incident - Create, Read
info.description: This service contains the basic information about an incident as the main entity, and persons involved, location, and attachments as dependent entities. For create operations, the information is sent in the request as a payload, except for attachment-related data. You can add attachments to the newly created incident in separate calls. Once the incident has been created, the incident data and global identification are sent in the response. For read operations, filter information can be sent according to the OData protocol. While creating an incident or retrieving incident data, the system performs checks for restricted values and authorization. If there are any issues, the system displays error messages in the response.

x-sap-shortText: Create and display incidents, near misses, and safety observations related to Environment, Health, and Safety using this synchronous inbound service

values.text: Environment, Health and Safety - Incident Reporting Integration(SAP_COM_0369)

x-sap-extensible.description:
API can be extended by custom fields on the following business contexts (field usage for this API needs to be selected):
* EHS Incident Root (EHHSS_INC_ROOT)

[How to add an extension field to an API](https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/ce819b8557194ae0aa180ba4ac6a04de.html)

post.summary: Uploads an attachment without assigning it to an incident.
post.description: It is not possible to create an attachment without assigning it to an incident. Use the following operation instead: POST /A_Incident( {IncidentUUID})/to_Attachments.

get.summary: Gets a list of incidents by filter criteria.
get.description: Gets a list of incidents by filter criteria. You can search for incidents by incident category, incident date, incident title, and incident status. You can also sort the list by date, status, and category.

post.description: Creates a new incident. For this operation, the incident date and title parameters are required. To assign a person to an incident, use the operation POST /A_Incident( {IncidentUUID})/to_Persons. To attach a document, use the operation POST /A_Incident({IncidentUUID})/to_Attachments.

parameters.name: IncidentUUID
parameters.description: Incident Global Identification

get.summary: Gets incident details by global identifier (IncidentUUID).
get.description: Gets incident details by global identifier (IncidentUUID). Gets details from the incident record for which the IncidentUUID matches the provided key or returns nothing if no IncidentUUID matches the provided key.

get.description: Gets the incident location. Gets the location details assigned to an incident or returns nothing if no location is specified.

post.summary: Assigns a person to an incident.
post.description: Assigns a person to an incident. The role of the involved person must be provided for this operation.

parameters.name: IncidentUUID
parameters.description: Incident Global Identification

get.summary: Gets a list of documents attached to an incident.
get.description: Gets a list of documents that have been attached to an incident.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

post.summary: Attaches a document to an incident.
post.description: Attaches a document to an incident. Uploads an attachment and assigns it to an incident. You can add one attachment per operation call. To add multiple attachments, execute separate calls.

get.summary: Gets a list of all locations.
get.description: Gets a list of all existing locations. The list of locations is a flat list where the locations are sorted alphabetically by name.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.name: LocationUUID
parameters.description: Location Global Identification

get.summary: Gets details of the incident location by global identifier (LocationUUID).
get.description: Gets details of the location record for which the LocationUUID matches the provided key or returns nothing if no LocationUUID matches the provided key.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.summary: Creates a person record without assigning it to an incident.
post.description: It is not possible to create a person record without assigning it to an incident. Use the following operation instead: POST /A_Incident({IncidentUUID})/to_Persons.

Group multiple requests into a single request payload, see [Batch Requests](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=152).

*Please note that "Try it out" is not supported for this request.*
